main event: Three observers reported seeing a flying saucer in the skies of Colville, Washington, on July 6, 1953.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for nearly two hours and began at about 4:30 a.m.,The object appeared to move and then stop at times,It was described as a lighted object in the sky observed from Colville's Observation Tower, Two witnesses, Mrs. Willett and Mrs. Link, were on the ground and alerted another observer in the tower, There were no photographs or physical evidence documented in the report.
witness description: Mrs. Gerald Willett, Mrs. John Link, and Mr. Willett
